segments.text: I notice the boy on the stool, reaching for the cookie jar like it’s the most important thing in the world.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The stool looks like it’s about to tip over, but he doesn’t care.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: His sister is watching him, waiting for her share, completely oblivious to the danger.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I think they’re going to fall any second now.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The woman is right there, but she’s too busy drying that plate to notice.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I can almost feel the tension, like everything is about to go wrong.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The water is still pouring out of the sink, making the floor even more dangerous.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I wonder if the boy will grab the jar before he falls.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The whole scene is a mess, and no one seems to care.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I can’t look away, even though I know something bad is going to happen.
segments.speaker: PAR
